sample_temperature_value_when_received.name: sample_temperature_value_when_received
sample_temperature_value_when_received.description: The numerical value of a measurement of temperature of a sample upon receipt.
sample_temperature_value_when_received.title: sample temperature value (when received)
comments: Provide the numerical value of the measured temperature.

sample_temperature_unit_when_received.name: sample_temperature_unit_when_received
sample_temperature_unit_when_received.description: The units of a measurement of temperature of a sample at the time upon receipt.
sample_temperature_unit_when_received.title: sample temperature unit (when received)
comments: Provide the units of the measured temperature.

purpose_of_sequencing.name: purpose_of_sequencing
purpose_of_sequencing.description: The reason that the sample was sequenced.
purpose_of_sequencing.title: purpose of sequencing
comments: The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing. The reason a sample was sequenced may provide information about potential biases in sequencing strategy. Provide the purpose of sequencing from the picklist in the template. The reason for sample collection should be indicated in the "purpose of sampling" field.

purpose_of_sequencing_details.name: purpose_of_sequencing_details
purpose_of_sequencing_details.description: The description of why the sample was sequenced providing specific details.
purpose_of_sequencing_details.title: purpose of sequencing details
comments: Provide an expanded description of why the sample was sequenced using free text. The description may include the importance of the sequences for a particular public health investigation/surveillance activity/research question. Suggested standardized descriptions include: Assessing public health control measures, Determining early introductions and spread, Investigating airline-related exposures, Investigating remote regions, Investigating health care workers, Investigating schools/universities.

sequenced_by.name: sequenced_by
sequenced_by.description: The name of the agency, organization or institution responsible for sequencing the isolate's genome.
sequenced_by.title: sequenced by
comments: Provide the name of the agency, organization or institution that performed the sequencing in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

sequenced_by_laboratory_name.name: sequenced_by_laboratory_name
sequenced_by_laboratory_name.description: The specific laboratory affiliation of the responsible for sequencing the isolate's genome.
sequenced_by_laboratory_name.title: sequenced by laboratory name
comments: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that that performed the sequencing in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

sequenced_by_contact_name.name: sequenced_by_contact_name
sequenced_by_contact_name.description: The name or title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.
sequenced_by_contact_name.title: sequenced by contact name
comments: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is more prefereable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

sequenced_by_contact_email.name: sequenced_by_contact_email
sequenced_by_contact_email.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.
sequenced_by_contact_email.title: sequenced by contact email
comments: Provide the email associated with the listed contact. As personnel turnover may render an individual's email obsolete, it is more prefereable to provide an address for a position or lab, to ensure accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

sequence_submitted_by.name: sequence_submitted_by
sequence_submitted_by.description: The name of the agency that submitted the sequence to a database.
sequence_submitted_by.title: sequence submitted by
comments: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions. For Canadian institutions submitting specimens rather than sequencing data, please put the "National Microbiology Laboratory (NML)".

sequence_submitter_contact_email.name: sequence_submitter_contact_email
sequence_submitter_contact_email.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.
sequence_submitter_contact_email.title: sequence submitter contact email
comments: The email address can represent a specific individual or laboratory.

sequencing_date.name: sequencing_date
sequencing_date.description: The date the sample was sequenced.
sequencing_date.title: sequencing date
comments: ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD".

library_id.name: library_id
library_id.description: The user-specified identifier for the library prepared for sequencing.
library_id.title: library ID
comments: The library name should be unique, and can be an autogenerated ID from your LIMS, or modification of the isolate ID.

sequencing_platform.name: sequencing_platform
sequencing_platform.description: The platform technology used to perform the sequencing.
sequencing_platform.title: sequencing platform
comments: Provide the name of the company that created the sequencing instrument by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

sequencing_instrument.name: sequencing_instrument
sequencing_instrument.description: The model of the sequencing instrument used.
sequencing_instrument.title: sequencing instrument
comments: Provide the model sequencing instrument by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

sequencing_assay_type.name: sequencing_assay_type
sequencing_assay_type.description: The overarching sequencing methodology that was used to determine the sequence of a biomaterial.
sequencing_assay_type.title: sequencing assay type
comments: Provide the name of the DNA or RNA sequencing technology used in your study. If unsure refer to the protocol documentation, or provide a null value.

library_preparation_kit.name: library_preparation_kit
library_preparation_kit.description: The name of the DNA library preparation kit used to generate the library being sequenced.
library_preparation_kit.title: library preparation kit
comments: Provide the name of the library preparation kit used.

sequencing_protocol.name: sequencing_protocol
sequencing_protocol.description: The protocol or method used for sequencing.
sequencing_protocol.title: sequencing protocol
comments: Provide the name and version of the procedure or protocol used for sequencing. You can also provide a link to a protocol online.

dna_fragment_length.name: dna_fragment_length
dna_fragment_length.description: The length of the DNA fragment generated by mechanical shearing or enzymatic digestion for the purposes of library preparation.
dna_fragment_length.title: DNA fragment length
comments: Provide the fragment length in base pairs (do not include the units).

genomic_target_enrichment_method.name: genomic_target_enrichment_method
genomic_target_enrichment_method.description: The molecular technique used to selectively capture and amplify specific regions of interest from a genome.
genomic_target_enrichment_method.title: genomic target enrichment method
comments: Provide the name of the enrichment method

genomic_target_enrichment_method_details.name: genomic_target_enrichment_method_details
genomic_target_enrichment_method_details.description: Details that provide additional context to the molecular technique used to selectively capture and amplify specific regions of interest from a genome.
genomic_target_enrichment_method_details.title: genomic target enrichment method details
comments: Provide details that are applicable to the method you used.

examples.value: enrichment was done using Illumina Target Enrichment methodology with the Illumina DNA Prep with enrichment kit.

amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme.name: amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme
amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme.description: The specifications of the primers (primer sequences, binding positions, fragment size generated etc) used to generate the amplicons to be sequenced.
amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme.title: amplicon pcr primer scheme
comments: Provide the name and version of the primer scheme used to generate the amplicons for sequencing.

amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme_url.name: amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme_url
amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme_url.description: A URL linking to detailed information or documentation about the amplicon PCR primer scheme, including specifications such as primer sequences, binding positions, and fragment sizes. This URL should direct users to a source that provides the necessary details to reproduce or understand the primer scheme used in the dataset.
amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme_url.title: amplicon pcr primer scheme URL
comments: Provide the url of the primer scheme used to generate the amplicons for sequencing.

amplicon_size.name: amplicon_size
amplicon_size.description: The length of the amplicon generated by PCR amplification.
amplicon_size.title: amplicon size
comments: Provide the amplicon size expressed in base pairs.

quality_control_method_name.name: quality_control_method_name
quality_control_method_name.description: The name of the method used to assess whether a sequence passed a predetermined quality control threshold.
quality_control_method_name.title: quality control method name
comments: Providing the name of the method used for quality control is very important for interpreting the rest of the QC information. Method names can be provided as the name of a pipeline or a link to a GitHub repository. Multiple methods should be listed and separated by a semi-colon. Do not include QC tags in other fields if no method name is provided.

quality_control_method_version.name: quality_control_method_version
quality_control_method_version.description: The version number of the method used to assess whether a sequence passed a predetermined quality control threshold.
quality_control_method_version.title: quality control method version
comments: Methods updates can make big differences to their outputs. Provide the version of the method used for quality control. The version can be expressed using whatever convention the developer implements (e.g. date, semantic versioning). If multiple methods were used, record the version numbers in the same order as the method names. Separate the version numbers using a semi-colon.

quality_control_determination.name: quality_control_determination
quality_control_determination.description: The determination of a quality control assessment.
quality_control_determination.title: quality control determination
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided. If a desired value is missing, submit a new term request to the PHA4GE QC Tag GitHub issuetracker using the New Term Request form.

quality_control_issues.name: quality_control_issues
quality_control_issues.description: The reason contributing to, or causing, a low quality determination in a quality control assessment.
quality_control_issues.title: quality control issues
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided. If a desired value is missing, submit a new term request to the PHA4GE QC Tag GitHub issuetracker using the New Term Request form.

quality_control_details.name: quality_control_details
quality_control_details.description: The details surrounding a low quality determination in a quality control assessment.
quality_control_details.title: quality control details
comments: Provide notes or details regarding QC results using free text.

examples.value: CT value of 39. Low viral load. Low DNA concentration after amplification.

raw_sequence_data_processing_method.name: raw_sequence_data_processing_method
raw_sequence_data_processing_method.description: The method used for raw data processing such as removing barcodes, adapter trimming, filtering etc.
raw_sequence_data_processing_method.title: raw sequence data processing method
comments: Provide the software name followed by the version or a link to the github protocol e.g. Trimmomatic v. 0.38, Porechop v. 0.2.3

dehosting_method.name: dehosting_method
dehosting_method.description: The method used to remove host reads from the pathogen sequence.
dehosting_method.title: dehosting method
comments: Provide the name and version number of the software used to remove host reads.

genome_sequence_file_name.name: genome_sequence_file_name
genome_sequence_file_name.description: The name of the consensus sequence file.
genome_sequence_file_name.title: genome sequence file name
comments: Provide the name and version number, with the file extension, of the processed genome sequence file e.g. a consensus sequence FASTA file or a genome assembly file.

genome_sequence_file_path.name: genome_sequence_file_path
genome_sequence_file_path.description: The filepath of the consensus sequence file.
genome_sequence_file_path.title: genome sequence file path
comments: Provide the filepath of the genome sequence FASTA file.

sequence_assembly_software_name.name: sequence_assembly_software_name
sequence_assembly_software_name.description: The name of the software used to assemble a sequence.
sequence_assembly_software_name.title: sequence assembly software name
comments: Provide the name of the software used to assemble the sequence.

examples.value: SPAdes Genome Assembler, Canu, wtdbg2, velvet

sequence_assembly_software_version.name: sequence_assembly_software_version
sequence_assembly_software_version.description: The version of the software used to assemble a sequence.
sequence_assembly_software_version.title: sequence assembly software version
comments: Provide the version of the software used to assemble the sequence.

consensus_sequence_software_name.name: consensus_sequence_software_name
consensus_sequence_software_name.description: The name of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.
consensus_sequence_software_name.title: consensus sequence software name
comments: Provide the name of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

consensus_sequence_software_version.name: consensus_sequence_software_version
consensus_sequence_software_version.description: The version of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.
consensus_sequence_software_version.title: consensus sequence software version
comments: Provide the version of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

breadth_of_coverage_value.name: breadth_of_coverage_value
breadth_of_coverage_value.description: The percentage of the reference genome covered by the sequenced data, to a prescribed depth.
breadth_of_coverage_value.title: breadth of coverage value
comments: Provide value as a percent.

depth_of_coverage_value.name: depth_of_coverage_value
depth_of_coverage_value.description: The average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.
depth_of_coverage_value.title: depth of coverage value
comments: Provide value as a fold of coverage.

depth_of_coverage_threshold.name: depth_of_coverage_threshold
depth_of_coverage_threshold.description: The threshold used as a cut-off for the depth of coverage.
depth_of_coverage_threshold.title: depth of coverage threshold
comments: Provide the threshold fold coverage.

genome_completeness.name: genome_completeness
genome_completeness.description: The percentage of expected genes identified in the genome being sequenced. Missing genes indicate missing genomic regions (incompleteness) in the data.
genome_completeness.title: genome completeness
comments: Provide the genome completeness as a percent (no need to include units).

number_of_base_pairs_sequenced.name: number_of_base_pairs_sequenced
number_of_base_pairs_sequenced.description: The number of total base pairs generated by the sequencing process.
number_of_base_pairs_sequenced.title: number of base pairs sequenced
comments: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

number_of_total_reads.name: number_of_total_reads
number_of_total_reads.description: The total number of non-unique reads generated by the sequencing process.
number_of_total_reads.title: number of total reads
comments: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

number_of_unique_reads.name: number_of_unique_reads
number_of_unique_reads.description: The number of unique reads generated by the sequencing process.
number_of_unique_reads.title: number of unique reads
comments: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

minimum_posttrimming_read_length.name: minimum_posttrimming_read_length
minimum_posttrimming_read_length.description: The threshold used as a cut-off for the minimum length of a read after trimming.
minimum_posttrimming_read_length.title: minimum post-trimming read length
comments: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

number_of_contigs.name: number_of_contigs
number_of_contigs.description: The number of contigs (contiguous sequences) in a sequence assembly.
number_of_contigs.title: number of contigs
comments: Provide a numerical value.

percent_ns_across_total_genome_length.name: percent_ns_across_total_genome_length
percent_ns_across_total_genome_length.description: The percentage of the assembly that consists of ambiguous bases (Ns).
percent_ns_across_total_genome_length.title: percent Ns across total genome length
comments: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

ns_per_100_kbp.name: ns_per_100_kbp
ns_per_100_kbp.description: The number of ambiguous bases (Ns) normalized per 100 kilobasepairs (kbp).
ns_per_100_kbp.title: Ns per 100 kbp
comments: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

n50.name: n50
n50.description: The length of the shortest read that, together with other reads, represents at least 50% of the nucleotides in a set of sequences.
n50.title: N50
comments: Provide the N50 value in Mb.

percent_read_contamination.name: percent_read_contamination
percent_read_contamination.description: The percent of the total number of reads identified as contamination (not belonging to the target organism) in a sequence dataset.
percent_read_contamination.title: percent read contamination
comments: Provide the percent contamination value (no need to include units).

sequence_assembly_length.name: sequence_assembly_length
sequence_assembly_length.description: The length of the genome generated by assembling reads using a scaffold or by reference-based mapping.
sequence_assembly_length.title: sequence assembly length
comments: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

consensus_genome_length.name: consensus_genome_length
consensus_genome_length.description: The length of the genome defined by the most common nucleotides at each position.
consensus_genome_length.title: consensus genome length
comments: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

reference_genome_accession.name: reference_genome_accession
reference_genome_accession.description: A persistent, unique identifier of a genome database entry.
reference_genome_accession.title: reference genome accession
comments: Provide the accession number of the reference genome.

deduplication_method.name: deduplication_method
deduplication_method.description: The method used to remove duplicated reads in a sequence read dataset.
deduplication_method.title: deduplication method
comments: Provide the deduplication software name followed by the version, or a link to a tool or method.

bioinformatics_protocol.name: bioinformatics_protocol
bioinformatics_protocol.description: A description of the overall bioinformatics strategy used.
bioinformatics_protocol.title: bioinformatics protocol
comments: Further details regarding the methods used to process raw data, and/or generate assemblies, and/or generate consensus sequences can. This information can be provided in an SOP or protocol or pipeline/workflow. Provide the name and version number of the protocol, or a GitHub link to a pipeline or workflow.

read_mapping_software_name.name: read_mapping_software_name
read_mapping_software_name.description: The name of the software used to map sequence reads to a reference genome or set of reference genes.
read_mapping_software_name.title: read mapping software name
comments: Provide the name of the read mapping software.

read_mapping_software_version.name: read_mapping_software_version
read_mapping_software_version.description: The version of the software used to map sequence reads to a reference genome or set of reference genes.
read_mapping_software_version.title: read mapping software version
comments: Provide the version number of the read mapping software.

taxonomic_reference_database_name.name: taxonomic_reference_database_name
taxonomic_reference_database_name.description: The name of the taxonomic reference database used to identify the organism.
taxonomic_reference_database_name.title: taxonomic reference database name
comments: Provide the name of the taxonomic reference database.

taxonomic_reference_database_version.name: taxonomic_reference_database_version
taxonomic_reference_database_version.description: The version of the taxonomic reference database used to identify the organism.
taxonomic_reference_database_version.title: taxonomic reference database version
comments: Provide the version number of the taxonomic reference database.

taxonomic_analysis_report_filename.name: taxonomic_analysis_report_filename
taxonomic_analysis_report_filename.description: The filename of the report containing the results of a taxonomic analysis.
taxonomic_analysis_report_filename.title: taxonomic analysis report filename
comments: Provide the filename of the report containing the results of the taxonomic analysis.

taxonomic_analysis_date.name: taxonomic_analysis_date
taxonomic_analysis_date.description: The date a taxonomic analysis was performed.
taxonomic_analysis_date.title: taxonomic analysis date
comments: Providing the date that an analyis was performed can help provide context for tool and reference database versions. Provide the date that the taxonomic analysis was performed in ISO 8601 format, i.e. "YYYY-MM-DD".

read_mapping_criteria.name: read_mapping_criteria
read_mapping_criteria.description: A description of the criteria used to map reads to a reference sequence.
read_mapping_criteria.title: read mapping criteria
comments: Provide a description of the read mapping criteria.

amr_analysis_software_name.name: amr_analysis_software_name
amr_analysis_software_name.description: The name of the software used to perform an in silico antimicrobial resistance determinant identification/analysis.
amr_analysis_software_name.title: AMR analysis software name
comments: Provide the name of the software used for AMR analysis.

amr_analysis_software_version.name: amr_analysis_software_version
amr_analysis_software_version.description: The version number of the software used to perform an in silico antimicrobial resistance determinant idenrtification/analysis.
amr_analysis_software_version.title: AMR analysis software version
comments: Provide the version number of the software used for AMR analysis.

amr_reference_database_name.name: amr_reference_database_name
amr_reference_database_name.description: Thr name of the reference database used to perform an in silico antimicrobial resistance determinant identification/analysis.
amr_reference_database_name.title: AMR reference database name
comments: Provide the name of the reference database used for AMR analysis.

amr_reference_database_version.name: amr_reference_database_version
amr_reference_database_version.description: The version number of the reference database used to perform an in silico antimicrobial resistance determinant identification/analysis.
amr_reference_database_version.title: AMR reference database version
comments: Provide the version number of the reference database used for AMR analysis.

amr_analysis_report_filename.name: amr_analysis_report_filename
amr_analysis_report_filename.description: The filename of the report containing the results of an in silico antimicrobial resistance analysis.
amr_analysis_report_filename.title: AMR analysis report filename
comments: Provide the filename of the report containing the results of the AMR analysis.

amr_analysis_date.name: amr_analysis_date
amr_analysis_date.description: The date the antimicrobial resistance analysis was performed.
amr_analysis_date.title: AMR analysis date
comments: Providing the date that an analyis was performed can help provide context for tool and reference database versions. Provide the date that the analysis was performed in ISO 8601 format, i.e. "YYYY-MM-DD".

lineage_clade_name.name: lineage_clade_name
lineage_clade_name.description: The name of the lineage or clade.
lineage_clade_name.title: lineage/clade name
comments: Provide the Pangolin or Nextstrain lineage/clade name. Multiple lineages/clades can be provided, separated by a semicolon.

lineage_clade_analysis_software_name.name: lineage_clade_analysis_software_name
lineage_clade_analysis_software_name.description: The name of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.
lineage_clade_analysis_software_name.title: lineage/clade analysis software name
comments: Provide the name of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.

lineage_clade_analysis_software_version.name: lineage_clade_analysis_software_version
lineage_clade_analysis_software_version.description: The version of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.
lineage_clade_analysis_software_version.title: lineage/clade analysis software version
comments: Provide the version of the software used ot determine the lineage/clade.

lineage_clade_analysis_report_filename.name: lineage_clade_analysis_report_filename
lineage_clade_analysis_report_filename.description: The filename of the report containing the results of a lineage/clade analysis.
lineage_clade_analysis_report_filename.title: lineage/clade analysis report filename
comments: Provide the filename of the report containing the results of the lineage/clade analysis.

lineage_clade_analysis_date.name: lineage_clade_analysis_date
lineage_clade_analysis_date.description: The date of the lineage/clade analysis was performed.
lineage_clade_analysis_date.title: lineage/clade analysis date
comments: Providing the date that an analyis was performed can help provide context for tool and reference database versions. Provide the date that the analysis was performed in ISO 8601 format, i.e. "YYYY-MM-DD".

target_taxonomic_name_1.name: target_taxonomic_name_1
target_taxonomic_name_1.description: The scientific name of the organism or taxon that is the focus of the study, assay, or diagnostic test.
target_taxonomic_name_1.title: target taxonomic name 1
comments: The target taxonomic name refers to the specific species, genus, or other taxonomic classification that the assay or diagnostic test is designed to identify, detect, or characterize. This may include the full binomial name (Genus species) or a higher taxonomic rank (e.g., genus, family) when species-level identification is not applicable.  Avoid abbreviations. Search for taxonomic names here: ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy.

assay_target_name_1.name: assay_target_name_1
assay_target_name_1.description: The name of the assay target used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
assay_target_name_1.title: assay target name 1
comments: The specific genomic region, sequence, or variant targeted by the assay in a diagnostic RT-PCR test. This may include parts of a gene, non-coding regions, or other genetic elements that serve as a marker for detecting the presence of a pathogen or other relevant entities.

assay_target_details_1.name: assay_target_details_1
assay_target_details_1.description: Describe any details of the assay target.
assay_target_details_1.title: assay target details 1
comments: Provide details that are applicable to the assay used for the diagnostic test.

gene_symbol_1.name: gene_symbol_1
gene_symbol_1.description: The symbol of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
gene_symbol_1.title: gene symbol 1

diagnostic_target_presence_1.name: diagnostic_target_presence_1
diagnostic_target_presence_1.description: The binary value of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_target_presence_1.title: diagnostic target presence 1
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided, to describe whether a target was determined to be present or absent within a sample.

diagnostic_measurement_value_1.name: diagnostic_measurement_value_1
diagnostic_measurement_value_1.description: The value of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_measurement_value_1.title: diagnostic measurement value 1
comments: Provide the numerical result of a diagnostic test (no need to include units).

diagnostic_measurement_unit_1.name: diagnostic_measurement_unit_1
diagnostic_measurement_unit_1.description: The unit of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_measurement_unit_1.title: diagnostic measurement unit 1
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided, to describe the units of the given diagnostic test.

diagnostic_measurement_method_1.name: diagnostic_measurement_method_1
diagnostic_measurement_method_1.description: The method by which a diagnostic result was determined.
diagnostic_measurement_method_1.title: diagnostic measurement method 1
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided to describe the method used for a given diagnostic test.

assay_target_name_2.name: assay_target_name_2
assay_target_name_2.description: The name of the assay target used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
assay_target_name_2.title: assay target name 2
comments: The specific genomic region, sequence, or variant targeted by the assay in a diagnostic RT-PCR test. This may include parts of a gene, non-coding regions, or other genetic elements that serve as a marker for detecting the presence of a pathogen or other relevant entities.

assay_target_details_2.name: assay_target_details_2
assay_target_details_2.description: Describe any details of the assay target.
assay_target_details_2.title: assay target details 2
comments: Provide details that are applicable to the assay used for the diagnostic test.

gene_symbol_2.name: gene_symbol_2
gene_symbol_2.description: The symbol of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
gene_symbol_2.title: gene symbol 2

diagnostic_target_presence_2.name: diagnostic_target_presence_2
diagnostic_target_presence_2.description: The binary value of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_target_presence_2.title: diagnostic target presence 2
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided, to describe whether a target was determined to be present or absent within a sample.

diagnostic_measurement_value_2.name: diagnostic_measurement_value_2
diagnostic_measurement_value_2.description: The value of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_measurement_value_2.title: diagnostic measurement value 2
comments: Provide the numerical result of a diagnostic test (no need to include units).

diagnostic_measurement_unit_2.name: diagnostic_measurement_unit_2
diagnostic_measurement_unit_2.description: The unit of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_measurement_unit_2.title: diagnostic measurement unit 2
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided, to describe the units of the given diagnostic test.

diagnostic_measurement_method_2.name: diagnostic_measurement_method_2
diagnostic_measurement_method_2.description: The method by which a diagnostic result was determined.
diagnostic_measurement_method_2.title: diagnostic measurement method 2
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided to describe the method used for a given diagnostic test.

assay_target_name_3.name: assay_target_name_3
assay_target_name_3.description: The name of the assay target used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
assay_target_name_3.title: assay target name 3
comments: The specific genomic region, sequence, or variant targeted by the assay in a diagnostic RT-PCR test. This may include parts of a gene, non-coding regions, or other genetic elements that serve as a marker for detecting the presence of a pathogen or other relevant entities.

assay_target_details_3.name: assay_target_details_3
assay_target_details_3.description: Describe any details of the assay target.
assay_target_details_3.title: assay target details 3
comments: Provide details that are applicable to the assay used for the diagnostic test.

gene_symbol_3.name: gene_symbol_3
gene_symbol_3.description: The symbol of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
gene_symbol_3.title: gene symbol 3

diagnostic_target_presence_3.name: diagnostic_target_presence_3
diagnostic_target_presence_3.description: The binary value of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_target_presence_3.title: diagnostic target presence 3
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided, to describe whether a target was determined to be present or absent within a sample.

diagnostic_measurement_value_3.name: diagnostic_measurement_value_3
diagnostic_measurement_value_3.description: The value of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_measurement_value_3.title: diagnostic measurement value 3
comments: Provide the numerical result of a diagnostic test (no need to include units).

diagnostic_measurement_unit_3.name: diagnostic_measurement_unit_3
diagnostic_measurement_unit_3.description: The unit of the result from a diagnostic test.
diagnostic_measurement_unit_3.title: diagnostic measurement unit 3
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided, to describe the units of the given diagnostic test.

diagnostic_measurement_method_3.name: diagnostic_measurement_method_3
diagnostic_measurement_method_3.description: The method by which a diagnostic result was determined.
diagnostic_measurement_method_3.title: diagnostic measurement method 3
comments: Select a value from the pick list provided to describe the method used for a given diagnostic test.

WastewaterSARS-CoV-2.name: WastewaterSARS-CoV-2
WastewaterSARS-CoV-2.description: Specification for Wastewater SARS-CoV-2 virus biosample data gathering

organism.name: organism
comments: Provide the official nomenclature for the organism present in the sample. For SARS-CoV-2, use "Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2" provided in the picklist.

gene_symbol_1.name: gene_symbol_1
comments: Select a gene name value from the pick list provided.

gene_symbol_2.name: gene_symbol_2
comments: Select a gene name value from the pick list provided.

gene_symbol_3.name: gene_symbol_3
comments: Select a gene name value from the pick list provided.

specimen_collector_sample_id.name: specimen_collector_sample_id
specimen_collector_sample_id.description: The user-defined name for the sample.
specimen_collector_sample_id.title: specimen collector sample ID
comments: Store the collector sample ID. If this number is considered identifiable information, provide an alternative ID. Be sure to store the key that maps between the original and alternative IDs for traceability and follow up if necessary. Every collector sample ID from a single submitter must be unique. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab.

specimen_collector_subsample_id.name: specimen_collector_subsample_id
specimen_collector_subsample_id.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a portion of the original sample.
specimen_collector_subsample_id.title: specimen collector subsample ID
comments: Store the ID for the subsample/aliquot.

pooled_sample_id.name: pooled_sample_id
pooled_sample_id.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a combined (pooled) set of samples.
pooled_sample_id.title: pooled sample ID
comments: If the sample being analyzed is the result of pooling individual samples, rename the pooled sample with a new identifier. Store the pooled sample ID.

specimen_collector_project_id.name: specimen_collector_project_id
specimen_collector_project_id.description: The user-defined project name assigned to a sequencing project.
specimen_collector_project_id.title: specimen collector project ID
comments: If the sample was collected or analyzed under the umbrella of a specific project, include the name of that project here.

bioproject_accession.name: bioproject_accession
bioproject_accession.description: The INSDC (i.e., ENA, NCBI, or DDBJ) accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs.
bioproject_accession.title: BioProject accession
comments: Store the BioProject accession number. BioProjects are an organizing tool that links together raw sequence data, assemblies, and their associated metadata. Each province will be assigned a different bioproject accession number by the National Microbiology Lab. A valid NCBI BioProject accession has prefix PRJN e.g., PRJNA12345, and is created once at the beginning of a new sequencing project.

biosample_accession.name: biosample_accession
biosample_accession.description: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in INSDC (i.e., ENA, NCBI, or DDBJ) archives.
biosample_accession.title: BioSample accession
comments: Store the accession returned from the BioSample submission. NCBI BioSamples will have the prefix SAMN, ENA have the prefix SAMEA, DDBJ have SAMD

insdc_sequence_read_accession.name: insdc_sequence_read_accession
insdc_sequence_read_accession.description: The identifier assigned to a sequence in one of the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) repositories.
insdc_sequence_read_accession.title: INSDC sequence read accession
comments: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) sequence accessions start with ERR, NCBI-SRA accessions start with SRR,  DNA Data Bank of Japan (DDBJ) accessions start with DRR and Genome Sequence Archive (GSA) accessions start with CRR.

enterobase_accession.name: enterobase_accession
enterobase_accession.description: The identifier assigned to a sequence in Enterobase archives.
enterobase_accession.title: Enterobase accession
comments: Store the barcode assigned to the submitted sequence. Enterobase barcodes start with different 3 letter codes depending on the organism.

insdc_assembly_accession.name: insdc_assembly_accession
insdc_assembly_accession.description: The versioned identifier assigned to an assembly or consensus sequence in  one of the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) repositories.
insdc_assembly_accession.title: INSDC assembly accession
comments: Store the versioned accession assigned to the submitted sequence e.g. the GenBank accession version.

gisaid_accession.name: gisaid_accession
gisaid_accession.description: The identifier assigned to a sequence in GISAID (the Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data) archives.
gisaid_accession.title: GISAID accession
comments: Store the accession assigned to the submitted sequence. GISAID accessions start with EPI.

gisaid_virus_name.name: gisaid_virus_name
gisaid_virus_name.description: The user-defined GISAID virus name assigned to the sequence.
gisaid_virus_name.title: GISAID virus name
comments: GISAID virus names should be in the format "hCoV-19/Country/Identifier/year".

sampling_site_id.name: sampling_site_id
sampling_site_id.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a specific location from which samples are taken.
sampling_site_id.title: sampling site ID
comments: Store the ID for the site from which a sample was taken. The "site" is user defined (e.g. it may be a building and its environs, a specific entity within an environment). Please use the same site ID for all samples from a given site, regardless of when these samples were taken. Any important changes in site location, should be represented with a new site ID.

sampling_event_id.name: sampling_event_id
sampling_event_id.description: The user-defined identifier assigned to a specific event during which one or more samples are taken, from one or more sites.
sampling_event_id.title: sampling event ID
comments: Store the ID for the event during which a sample or samples were taken. For example, an event could be one person taking samples from multiple sites, or multiple people taking samples from one site.

sample_collection_data_steward_name.name: sample_collection_data_steward_name
sample_collection_data_steward_name.description: The name of the individual responsible for the data governance, (meta)data usage and distribution of the sample.
sample_collection_data_steward_name.title: sample collection data steward name
comments: Provide the name of the sample collection data steward.

sample_collected_by_laboratory_name.name: sample_collected_by_laboratory_name
sample_collected_by_laboratory_name.description: The specific laboratory affiliation of the sample collector.
sample_collected_by_laboratory_name.title: sample collected by laboratory name
comments: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that collected the sample (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

sample_collected_by.name: sample_collected_by
sample_collected_by.description: The name of the organization with which the sample collector is affiliated.
sample_collected_by.title: sample collected by
comments: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions.

sample_collector_contact_name.name: sample_collector_contact_name
sample_collector_contact_name.description: The name or job title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
sample_collector_contact_name.title: sample collector contact name
comments: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is more preferable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

sample_collector_contact_email.name: sample_collector_contact_email
sample_collector_contact_email.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
sample_collector_contact_email.title: sample collector contact email
comments: The email address can represent a specific individual or lab e.g. johnnyblogs@lab.ca, or RespLab@lab.ca

geo_loc_name_country.name: geo_loc_name_country
geo_loc_name_country.description: The country of origin of the sample.
geo_loc_name_country.title: geo loc name (country)
comments: If known, select a value from the pick list.

geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.name: geo_loc_name_state_province_territory
geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.description: The state/province/territory of origin of the sample.
geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.title: geo loc name (state/province/territory)
comments: Provide the state/province/territory name from the GAZ geography ontology. Search for geography terms here: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/ga

geo_loc_name_county_region.name: geo_loc_name_county_region
geo_loc_name_county_region.description: The county/region of origin of the sample.
geo_loc_name_county_region.title: geo loc name (county/region)
comments: Provide the county/region name from the GAZ geography ontology. Search for geography terms here: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

geo_loc_name_city.name: geo_loc_name_city
geo_loc_name_city.description: The city of origin of the sample.
geo_loc_name_city.title: geo loc name (city)
comments: Provide the city name from the GAZ geography ontology. Search for geography terms here: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

geo_loc_name_site.name: geo_loc_name_site
geo_loc_name_site.description: The name of a specific geographical location e.g. Credit River (rather than river).
geo_loc_name_site.title: geo loc name (site)
comments: Provide the name of the specific geographical site using a specific noun (a word that names a certain place, thing).

geo_loc_latitude.name: geo_loc_latitude
geo_loc_latitude.description: The latitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.
geo_loc_latitude.title: geo loc latitude
comments: Provide latitude coordinates if available. Do not use the centre of the city/region/province/state/country or the location of your agency as a proxy, as this implicates a real location and is misleading. Specify as degrees latitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S".

geo_loc_longitude.name: geo_loc_longitude
geo_loc_longitude.description: The longitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.
geo_loc_longitude.title: geo loc longitude
comments: Provide longitude coordinates if available. Do not use the centre of the city/region/province/state/country or the location of your agency as a proxy, as this implicates a real location and is misleading. Specify as degrees longitude in format "d[dd.dddd] W|E".

watershed_shapefile_availability.name: watershed_shapefile_availability
watershed_shapefile_availability.description: The availability status of a shapefile descriping the catchment contributing to a watershed.
watershed_shapefile_availability.title: watershed shapefile availability
comments: Select a value from the picklist to describe whether or not a watershed shapefile would be available upon request.

watershed_shapefile_filename.name: watershed_shapefile_filename
watershed_shapefile_filename.description: The name of the watershed shapefile.
watershed_shapefile_filename.title: watershed shapefile filename
comments: Provide the shapefile filename corresponding to the watershed from which the sample was taken. If there are multiple files associated with the watershed, provide all names separated by commas.

organism.name: organism
organism.title: organism
comments: Provide the official nomenclature for the organism present in the sample. For SARS-CoV-2, use "Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2" provided in the picklist.

purpose_of_sampling.name: purpose_of_sampling
purpose_of_sampling.description: The reason that the sample was collected.
purpose_of_sampling.title: purpose of sampling
comments: The reason a sample was collected may provide information about potential biases in sampling strategy. Provide the purpose of sampling from the picklist in the template. Most likely, the sample was collected for Public health surveillance. The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing, which should be indicated in the "purpose of sequencing" field.

scale_of_sampling.name: scale_of_sampling
scale_of_sampling.description: The range of locations or entities sampled expressed in general terms.
scale_of_sampling.title: scale of sampling
comments: Provide the scale of wastewater sampling by selecting a value from the picklist.

sample_received_date.name: sample_received_date
sample_received_date.description: The date on which the sample was received.
sample_received_date.title: sample received date
comments: Provide the sample received date in ISO 8601 format, i.e. "YYYY-MM-DD".

sample_collection_start_date.name: sample_collection_start_date
sample_collection_start_date.description: The date on which the sample was collected, or sampling began for a continuous sample.
sample_collection_start_date.title: sample collection start date
comments: If your sample is a continuous sample please use this field to capture your start date. Sample collection date is critical for surveillance and many types of analyses. Required granularity includes year, month and day. The date should be provided in ISO 8601 standard format "YYYY-MM-DD".

sample_collection_end_date.name: sample_collection_end_date
sample_collection_end_date.description: The date on which sample collection ended for a continuous sample.
sample_collection_end_date.title: sample collection end date
comments: Provide the date that sample collection ended in ISO 8601 format i.e. YYYY-MM-DD

sample_processing_date.name: sample_processing_date
sample_processing_date.description: The date on which the sample was processed.
sample_processing_date.title: sample processing date
comments: Provide the sample processed date in ISO 8601 format, i.e. "YYYY-MM-DD". The sample may be collected and processed (e.g. filtered, extraction) on the same day, or on different dates.

sample_collection_start_time.name: sample_collection_start_time
sample_collection_start_time.description: The time at which sample collection began.
sample_collection_start_time.title: sample collection start time
comments: Provide this time in ISO 8601 24hr format, in your local time.

sample_collection_end_time.name: sample_collection_end_time
sample_collection_end_time.description: The time at which sample collection ended.
sample_collection_end_time.title: sample collection end time
comments: Provide this time in ISO 8601 24hr format, in your local time.

sample_collection_time_of_day.name: sample_collection_time_of_day
sample_collection_time_of_day.description: The descriptive time of day during which the sample was collected.
sample_collection_time_of_day.title: sample collection time of day
comments: If known, select a value from the pick list. The time of sample processing matters especially for grab samples, as fecal concentration in wastewater fluctuates over the course of the day.

sample_collection_time_duration_value.name: sample_collection_time_duration_value
sample_collection_time_duration_value.description: The amount of time over which the sample was collected.
sample_collection_time_duration_value.title: sample collection time duration value
comments: Provide the numerical value of time.

sample_collection_time_duration_unit.name: sample_collection_time_duration_unit
sample_collection_time_duration_unit.description: The units of the time duration measurement of sample collection.
sample_collection_time_duration_unit.title: sample collection time duration unit
comments: Provide the units from the pick list.

presampling_activity.name: presampling_activity
presampling_activity.description: The activities or variables upstream of sample collection that may affect the sample.
presampling_activity.title: presampling activity
comments: If there was an activity that would affect the sample prior to collection (this is different than sample processing), provide the activities by selecting one or more values from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

presampling_activity_details.name: presampling_activity_details
presampling_activity_details.description: The details of the activities or variables that affected the sample collected.
presampling_activity_details.title: presampling activity details
comments: Briefly describe the presampling activities using free text.

examples.value: Agricultural waste from large farm contributes waste to the site sampled.

sample_volume_measurement_value.name: sample_volume_measurement_value
sample_volume_measurement_value.description: The numerical value of the volume measurement of the sample collected.
sample_volume_measurement_value.title: sample volume measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of volume.

sample_volume_measurement_unit.name: sample_volume_measurement_unit
sample_volume_measurement_unit.description: The units of the volume measurement of the sample collected.
sample_volume_measurement_unit.title: sample volume measurement unit
comments: Provide the units from the pick list.

sample_storage_method.name: sample_storage_method
sample_storage_method.description: The process used to store the sample.
sample_storage_method.title: sample storage method
comments: Provide details of how the sample was stored from time of collection until time of processing. If there were issues with the cold chain storage, note those here.

examples.value: The sample was placed in a tube in a cooler bag during transportation (~3 hours) to the lab site. At this point the sample was placed in storage medium and put in a -10C freezer until it was processed and extracted 5 days later.

sample_storage_medium.name: sample_storage_medium
sample_storage_medium.description: The medium in which a sample is stored.
sample_storage_medium.title: sample storage medium
comments: Provide the name of the transport medium or storage medium used for this sample. If none was used, leave blank or write "None".

sample_storage_duration_value.name: sample_storage_duration_value
sample_storage_duration_value.description: The numerical value of the time measurement during which a sample is in storage.
sample_storage_duration_value.title: sample storage duration value
comments: Provide the numerical value of time.

sample_storage_duration_unit.name: sample_storage_duration_unit
sample_storage_duration_unit.description: The units of a measured sample storage duration.
sample_storage_duration_unit.title: sample storage duration unit
comments: Provide the units from the pick list.

specimen_processing.name: specimen_processing
specimen_processing.description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after receiving the sample.
specimen_processing.title: specimen processing
comments: Select processes from the picklist that were applied to this sample.

specimen_processing_details.name: specimen_processing_details
specimen_processing_details.description: The details of the processing applied to the sample during or after receiving the sample.
specimen_processing_details.title: specimen processing details
comments: Briefly describe the processes applied to the sample.

examples.value: 25 samples were pooled and further prepared as a single sample during library prep.

experimental_protocol_name.name: experimental_protocol_name
experimental_protocol_name.description: The name of the overarching experimental methodology that was used to process the biomaterial.
experimental_protocol_name.title: experimental protocol name
comments: Provide the name of the methodology used in your study. If available, provide a url link to the protocol.

experimental_protocol_url.name: experimental_protocol_url
experimental_protocol_url.title: experimental protocol url
comments: Provide a url link to the protocol.

environmental_site.name: environmental_site
environmental_site.description: An environmental location may describe a site in the natural or built environment e.g. contact surface, metal can, hospital, wet market, bat cave.
environmental_site.title: environmental site
comments: Provide a descriptor of the environmental site sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

proximal_environmental_site.name: proximal_environmental_site
proximal_environmental_site.description: An environmental location in the natural or built environment, that is proximal to a sampling location and which can impact a sample.
proximal_environmental_site.title: proximal environmental site
comments: Provide a descriptor of the environmental site close to the sampling site. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

environmental_material.name: environmental_material
environmental_material.description: A substance obtained from the natural or man-made environment e.g. soil, water, sewage.
environmental_material.title: environmental material
comments: Provide a descriptor of the environmental material sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

environmental_material_properties.name: environmental_material_properties
environmental_material_properties.description: The properties, characteristics and qualities of a substance obtained from the natural or man-made environment.
environmental_material_properties.title: environmental material properties
comments: Provide the environmental material properties by selecting descriptors from the pick list.

wastewater_system_type.name: wastewater_system_type
wastewater_system_type.description: The type or classification of a wastewater system e.g. sanitary sewer, combined sewer, latrine
wastewater_system_type.title: wastewater system type
comments: Provide the classification of the wastewater system by selecting from the provided pick list.

experimental_specimen_role_type.name: experimental_specimen_role_type
experimental_specimen_role_type.description: The type of role that the sample represents in the experiment.
experimental_specimen_role_type.title: experimental specimen role type
comments: Samples can play different types of roles in experiments. A sample under study in one experiment may act as a control or be a replicate of another sample in another experiment. This field is used to distinguish samples under study from controls, replicates, etc.  If the sample acted as an experimental control or a replicate, select a role type from the picklist. If the sample was not a control, leave blank or select "Not Applicable".

experimental_control_details.name: experimental_control_details
experimental_control_details.description: The details regarding the experimental control contained in the sample.
experimental_control_details.title: experimental control details
comments: Provide details regarding the nature of the reference strain used as a control, or what is was used to monitor.

examples.value: Human coronavirus 229E (HCoV-229E) spiked in sample as process control

collection_device.name: collection_device
collection_device.description: The instrument or container used to collect the sample e.g. grab sampler.
collection_device.title: collection device
comments: Provide a descriptor of the device used for sampling. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

collection_method.name: collection_method
collection_method.description: The process used to collect the sample.
collection_method.title: collection method
comments: Provide a descriptor of the collection method used for sampling. Use the picklist provided in the template. If not applicable, choose a null value.

nucleic_acid_extraction_method.name: nucleic_acid_extraction_method
nucleic_acid_extraction_method.description: The process used to extract genomic material from a sample.
nucleic_acid_extraction_method.title: nucleic acid extraction method
comments: Briefly describe the extraction method used.

examples.value: Direct wastewater RNA capture and purification via the "Sewage, Salt, Silica and SARS-CoV-2 (4S)" method v4 found at https://www.protocols.io/view/v-4-direct-wastewater-rna-capture-and-purification-36wgq581ygk5/v4

nucleic_acid_extraction_kit.name: nucleic_acid_extraction_kit
nucleic_acid_extraction_kit.description: The kit used to extract genomic material from a sample
nucleic_acid_extraction_kit.title: nucleic acid extraction kit
comments: Provide the name of the genomic extraction kit used.

endogenous_control_details.name: endogenous_control_details
endogenous_control_details.description: The description of the endogenous controls included when extracting a sample.
endogenous_control_details.title: endogenous control details
comments: Provide the names of endogenous controls that were used as a reference during extraction. If relevant, include titers of these controls, as well as whether any controls were expected but not identified in the sample.

extraction_recovery_efficiency_measureme.name: extraction_recovery_efficiency_measurement_value
extraction_recovery_efficiency_measureme.description: The recovery efficiency of an extraction, calculated as the amount of a synthetic or endogenous compound identified in the sample relative to the amount expected.
extraction_recovery_efficiency_measureme.title: extraction recovery efficiency measurement value
comments: Provide value as a percent.

extraction_recovery_efficiency_measureme.name: extraction_recovery_efficiency_measurement_method
extraction_recovery_efficiency_measureme.description: The method by which recovery efficiency of an extraction was calculated.
extraction_recovery_efficiency_measureme.title: extraction recovery efficiency measurement method
comments: Provide a brief description of how extraction recovery efficiency was measured or estimated.

water_catchment_area_human_population_me.name: water_catchment_area_human_population_measurement_value
water_catchment_area_human_population_me.description: The numerical value of the human population measurement that contributes to the composition of water in a catchment area.
water_catchment_area_human_population_me.title: water catchment area human population measurement value
comments: Where known, provide the numerical value of population size, i.e. the number of people.

water_catchment_area_human_population_ra.name: water_catchment_area_human_population_range
water_catchment_area_human_population_ra.description: The human population range of the water catchment that contributes effluent to a wastewater site.
water_catchment_area_human_population_ra.title: water catchment area human population range
comments: Where catchment population is not well known, provide an estimation of population size by selecting a value from the picklist.

water_catchment_area_human_population_me.name: water_catchment_area_human_population_measurement_method
water_catchment_area_human_population_me.description: The method by which a water catchment 's human population size was measured or estimated
water_catchment_area_human_population_me.title: water catchment area human population measurement method
comments: Provide a brief description of how catchment population size was measured or estimated.

examples.value: population of jurisdiction encompassing the wastewater service area

water_catchment_area_human_population_de.name: water_catchment_area_human_population_density_value
water_catchment_area_human_population_de.description: The numerical value describing the number of humans per geographical area in a water catchment.
water_catchment_area_human_population_de.title: water catchment area human population density value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the population density in the catchement area.

water_catchment_area_human_population_de.name: water_catchment_area_human_population_density_unit
water_catchment_area_human_population_de.description: The unit describing the number of humans per geographical area in a water catchment.
water_catchment_area_human_population_de.title: water catchment area human population density unit
comments: Provide the unit of the population density in the catchement area.

populated_area_type.name: populated_area_type
populated_area_type.description: A type of area that is populated by humans to different degrees.
populated_area_type.title: populated area type
comments: Provide the populated area type from the pick list.

sampling_weather_conditions.name: sampling_weather_conditions
sampling_weather_conditions.description: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
sampling_weather_conditions.title: sampling weather conditions
comments: Provide the weather conditions at the time of sample collection.

presampling_weather_conditions.name: presampling_weather_conditions
presampling_weather_conditions.description: Weather conditions prior to collection that may affect the sample.
presampling_weather_conditions.title: presampling weather conditions
comments: Provide the weather conditions prior to sample collection.

precipitation_measurement_value.name: precipitation_measurement_value
precipitation_measurement_value.description: The amount of water which has fallen during a precipitation process.
precipitation_measurement_value.title: precipitation measurement value
comments: Provide the quantity of precipitation in the area leading up to the time of sample collection.

precipitation_measurement_unit.name: precipitation_measurement_unit
precipitation_measurement_unit.description: The units of measurement for the amount of water which has fallen during a precipitation process.
precipitation_measurement_unit.title: precipitation measurement unit
comments: Provide the units of precipitation by selecting a value from the pick list.

precipitation_measurement_method.name: precipitation_measurement_method
precipitation_measurement_method.description: The process used to measure the amount of water which has fallen during a precipitation process.
precipitation_measurement_method.title: precipitation measurement method
comments: Provide the name of the procedure or method used to measure precipitation.

examples.value: Rain gauge over a 12 hour period prior to sample collection

ambient_temperature_measurement_value.name: ambient_temperature_measurement_value
ambient_temperature_measurement_value.description: The numerical value of a measurement of the ambient temperature.
ambient_temperature_measurement_value.title: ambient temperature measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the measured temperature.

ambient_temperature_measurement_unit.name: ambient_temperature_measurement_unit
ambient_temperature_measurement_unit.description: The units of a measurement of the ambient temperature.
ambient_temperature_measurement_unit.title: ambient temperature measurement unit
comments: Provide the units of the measured temperature.

ph_measurement_value.name: ph_measurement_value
ph_measurement_value.description: The measured pH value indicating the acidity or basicity(alkalinity) of an aqueous solution.
ph_measurement_value.title: pH measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the measured pH.

ph_measurement_method.name: ph_measurement_method
ph_measurement_method.description: The process used to measure pH value.
ph_measurement_method.title: pH measurement method
comments: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure pH.

total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_value.name: total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_value
total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_value.description: The numerical value of a measured fluid flow rate over the course of a day.
total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_value.title: total daily flow rate measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the measured flow rate.

total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_unit.name: total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_unit
total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_unit.description: The units of a measured fluid flow rate over the course of a day.
total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_unit.title: total daily flow rate measurement unit
comments: Provide the units of the measured flow rate by selecting a value from the pick list.

total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_method.name: total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_method
total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_method.description: The process used to measure total daily fluid flow rate.
total_daily_flow_rate_measurement_method.title: total daily flow rate measurement method
comments: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure flow rate.

instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_valu.name: instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_value
instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_valu.description: The numerical value of a measured instantaneous fluid flow rate.
instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_valu.title: instantaneous flow rate measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the measured flow rate.

instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_unit.name: instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_unit
instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_unit.description: The units of a measured instantaneous fluid flow rate.
instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_unit.title: instantaneous flow rate measurement unit
comments: Provide the units of the measured flow rate by selecting a value from the pick list.

instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_meth.name: instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_method
instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_meth.description: The process used to measure instantaneous fluid flow rate.
instantaneous_flow_rate_measurement_meth.title: instantaneous flow rate measurement method
comments: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure flow rate.

turbidity_measurement_value.name: turbidity_measurement_value
turbidity_measurement_value.description: The numerical value of a measurement of turbidity.
turbidity_measurement_value.title: turbidity measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the measured turbidity.

turbidity_measurement_unit.name: turbidity_measurement_unit
turbidity_measurement_unit.description: The units of a measurement of turbidity.
turbidity_measurement_unit.title: turbidity measurement unit
comments: Provide the units of the measured turbidity by selecting a value from the pick list.

turbidity_measurement_method.name: turbidity_measurement_method
turbidity_measurement_method.description: The process used to measure turbidity.
turbidity_measurement_method.title: turbidity measurement method
comments: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure turbidity.

dissolved_oxygen_measurement_value.name: dissolved_oxygen_measurement_value
dissolved_oxygen_measurement_value.description: The numerical value of a measurement of dissolved oxygen.
dissolved_oxygen_measurement_value.title: dissolved oxygen measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the measured dissolved oxygen.

dissolved_oxygen_measurement_unit.name: dissolved_oxygen_measurement_unit
dissolved_oxygen_measurement_unit.description: The units of a measurement of dissolved oxygen.
dissolved_oxygen_measurement_unit.title: dissolved oxygen measurement unit
comments: Provide the units of the measured dissolved oxygen by selecting a value from the pick list.

dissolved_oxygen_measurement_method.name: dissolved_oxygen_measurement_method
dissolved_oxygen_measurement_method.description: The method used to measure dissolved oxygen.
dissolved_oxygen_measurement_method.title: dissolved oxygen measurement method
comments: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure dissolved oxygen.

examples.value: Dissolved oxygen meter in vertical direction

oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.name: oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measurement_value
oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.description: The numerical value of a measurement of oxygen reduction potential (ORP).
oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.title: oxygen reduction potential (ORP) measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the measured oxygen reduction potential.

oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.name: oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measurement_unit
oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.description: The units of a measurement of oxygen reduction potential (ORP).
oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.title: oxygen reduction potential (ORP) measurement unit
comments: Provide the units of the measured oxygen reduction potential by selecting a value from the pick list.

oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.name: oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measurement_method
oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.description: The method used to measure oxygen reduction potential (ORP).
oxygen_reduction_potential_orp_measureme.title: oxygen reduction potential (ORP) measurement method
comments: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure oxygen reduction potential.

chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_v.name: chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_value
chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_v.description: The measured value from a chemical oxygen demand (COD) test.
chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_v.title: chemical oxygen demand (COD) measurement value
comments: Provide the numerical value of the COD test result.

chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_u.name: chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_unit
chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_u.description: The units associated with a value from a chemical oxygen demand (COD) test.
chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_u.title: chemical oxygen demand (COD) measurement unit
comments: Provide the units of the COD test result.

chemical_oxygen_demand_cod_measurement_m.title: chemical oxygen demand (COD) measurement method
comments: Provide the name of the procedure or technology used to measure COD.
